abstract.text: Options for creating scene sources and loading the scenes they contain.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

abstract.text: Create 3D games and add 3D content to apps using high-level scene descriptions, and easily add animations, physics simulation, particle effects, and realistic physically based rendering.
Error codes that identify errors found during a scene-file-format consistency check.

doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/S.title: Scene File Consistency Check Error Codes

abstract.text: An object that manages the data-reading tasks associated with loading scene contents from a file or data.
Options for playing animations loaded from a scene file, used with the
key in options dictionaries.
Options for creating scene sources and loading the scenes they contain.
An option for controlling the playback of animations in a scene file.
Locations to use for resolving relative URLs to external resources.
An option to validate scene files while loading.
An option for whether to transform assets loaded from the scene file for use in a coordinate system where the y-axis points up.
An option for whether to automatically scale the scene’s contents.
An option for automatically generating surface normals if they are absent when loading geometry.
An option for automatically merging portions of a scene graph during loading.
An option to attempt loading external resources using their URLs as specified in a scene file.
An option to interpret scene files exactly as specified by the scene file format.
An option to limit filesystem and network access for external resources referenced by a scene file.
Returns metadata about the scene.
The file contributors.
Constants identifying phases of SceneKit’s scene loading process, used in a
block.
The signature for the block that SceneKit calls periodically to report progress while loading a scene.
Metadata identifying the user and authoring tool that created a scene file, used with the
key.
Keys identifying errors found during a scene-file-format consistency check.
The metadata properties associated with a scene file, used by the
method.
Metadata describing the unit of measurement used in a scene file, used with the
key.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type that can be converted to and from an associated raw value.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.

value.text: A static, plain-text Unicode string object.
